CountryData.name: Japan
CountryData.description: Japan, the Land of the Rising Sun, is an archipelago nation consisting of four main islands – Honshu, Hokkaido, Kyushu, and Shikoku – and thousands of smaller islands. Known for its stunning natural beauty, rich cultural heritage, and technological advancements, Japan offers a diverse range of experiences, from serene temples and bustling cities to breathtaking mountain landscapes and pristine coastlines. It’s a country where ancient traditions seamlessly blend with modern innovation.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Japan has a relatively high population density.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides on Honshu, the largest island.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Japan is a relatively small country in terms of land area.
quickFacts.detail: Approximately 73% of the country is mountainous.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, but generally around 140 JPY per 1 USD.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital and economic center of Japan.
quickFacts.detail: Tokyo is one of the world's largest metropolitan areas.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The primary language spoken in Japan.
quickFacts.detail: Japanese has several distinct writing systems, including Hiragana, Katakana, and Kanji.

climateData.title: Japan's Climate
climateData.description: Japan experiences a diverse range of climates due to its island geography and mountainous terrain. Generally, it has a humid subtropical climate in the south, a temperate climate in the central regions, and a cool climate in the north.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring is a beautiful time to visit Japan, with cherry blossoms (sakura) in full bloom.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summers are hot and humid, with frequent rainfall, particularly in the west.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn offers stunning foliage and pleasant temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are cold and snowy, especially in the northern regions.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Fuji
naturalWonders.description: Mount Fuji, an active stratovolcano and Japan's highest peak, is a symbol of the country. Its perfectly symmetrical cone is a breathtaking sight and a popular climbing destination.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Rising to 3,776 meters (12,389 feet), Mount Fuji is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a sacred place in Shinto and Buddhist traditions. The surrounding Fuji Five Lakes region offers stunning views and various recreational activities.

naturalWonders.name: Yakushima Island
naturalWonders.description: Yakushima is a subtropical island renowned for its ancient cedar forests, including the iconic Jomon Sugi, one of the oldest and largest trees in the world.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site, Yakushima boasts a unique ecosystem with diverse flora and fauna. Its lush forests, waterfalls, and rugged coastline offer incredible hiking and wildlife viewing opportunities.

naturalWonders.name: Shirakami-Sanchi
naturalWonders.description: Shirakami-Sanchi is a vast, pristine temperate broadleaf forest in Hokkaido, known for its old-growth beech trees and stunning scenery.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This UNESCO World Heritage Site is one of the largest remaining old-growth forests in Japan. It’s a haven for wildlife and offers excellent hiking and camping opportunities. The area is characterized by its dramatic mountain landscapes and clear streams.

ecosystemData.title: Japanese Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Japan’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from subtropical rainforests to alpine meadows and coral reefs. These ecosystems support a wide array of plant and animal life, many of which are endemic to the islands.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: Japan’s coastal waters are home to a rich variety of marine life, including fish, marine mammals, and invertebrates.

statistics.details: Approximately 1,700 coral reefs exist along Japan's coastlines.
12 species of marine mammals, including dolphins and whales, inhabit Japanese waters.

notableSpecies.name: Japanese Macaque
notableSpecies.significance: One of the oldest populations of macaques in the world.

notableSpecies.name: Japanese Sea Lion
notableSpecies.significance: Critically endangered, with a small population remaining.

biodiversityCategories.name: Terrestrial Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: Japan’s mountainous terrain supports a diverse range of terrestrial ecosystems, including forests, grasslands, and alpine meadows.

statistics.details: 127 mammal species, including the Japanese serow and red fox.

notableSpecies.name: Japanese Giant Salamander
notableSpecies.significance: One of the largest salamanders in the world.

notableSpecies.name: Japanese Giant Flying Squirrel
notableSpecies.significance: A rare and elusive species found in the forests of Honshu.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Japan
activities.description: Japan offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from leisurely hikes to challenging climbs and water sports.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Japan is a hiker's paradise, with trails ranging from gentle coastal paths to challenging mountain ascents.

activities.name: Mount Fuji Climb
activities.description: A challenging but rewarding climb to the summit of Japan's iconic mountain.
activities.requirements: Good physical fitness, hiking boots, appropriate clothing

activities.name: Kumano Kodo Pilgrimage Trails
activities.description: A network of ancient pilgrimage trails through the mountains of the Kii Peninsula.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Japan’s coastline offers opportunities for a variety of water sports, from surfing to kayaking.

activities.name: Surfing in Okinawa
activities.description: Okinawa is known for its consistent waves and warm waters, making it a popular surfing destination.

activities.name: Kayaking in Lake Ashi
activities.description: Paddle across the picturesque Lake Ashi, surrounded by stunning views of Mount Fuji.

clothing.yearRound: Layers are recommended for unpredictable weather
